summary: This document is a government exhibit index from the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330), listing evidence to be produced to the defense. It catalogs a wide range of exhibits including message pads, birth certificates, physical items like massage tables and costumes, photographs, financial records, flight logs, and search photos from various properties. The index shows evidence was sealed, scaled, or public, indicating sensitive material related to the investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell; numerous exhibits relate to her, including photographs, financial records, and a relationship essay with Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the case; exhibits include photographs with Ghislaine Maxwell, email chains, flight logs, and records related to his properties and activities.

connections.description: Exhibits include photographs of them together, email chains between them, and an essay about their relationship, indicating a close personal and alleged conspiratorial association.

events.title: Evidence Production to Defense
events.description: Multiple exhibits were marked for identification and produced to the defense in the criminal case against Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Redacted Evidence Production
events.description: Redacted versions of previously sealed or scaled exhibits (e.g., birth certificates, invoices, personnel records) were produced to the defense or made public.

keyFacts: The document is an exhibit index for U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, showing the vast scope of evidence collected, including physical items, digital records, and photographs.
Many exhibits are sealed or scaled (e.g., message pad excerpts, birth certificates, contact lists), indicating sensitive content related to victims, associates, or investigative details.
Evidence includes items like a Florida massage table, a black contact book, costumes, and hard drives, suggesting the collection of potential instrumental and documentary evidence.
Financial records from J.P. Morgan and flight logs from 1991 to 2013 are listed, pointing to the investigation into Epstein and Maxwell's financial dealings and travel.
Search photographs from 358 El Brillo Way and a New York townhouse show interiors, including massage rooms, nude portraits, and sculptures, documenting the settings of alleged activities.
